Package tage.physics

Interface PhysicsEngine

All Known Implementing Classes:
JBulletPhysicsEngine
public interface PhysicsEngine
If using TAGE, this physics engine is instantiated automatically by the TAGE engine.

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_GRAVITY_X

      static final float DEFAULT_GRAVITY_X
      Constants defining the default gravity in the physics world. Note that implementations are not constrained to utilize the default values defined here.
      See Also:

  • Method Details

    • initSystem

      void initSystem()
      Initializes the underlying physics engine. Typical initializations include providing an (empty) "physics world" along with a default collision handler, collision dispatcher, and constraint solver. Note however that implementations are not constrained to perform any specific initializations when this method is called; check the documentation for a specific implementation to determine what actual initial values are set by the implementation.

    • setGravity

      void setGravity(float[] gravity_vector)
      Set the gravity in the physics simulation to the specified [x,y,z] vector.
      Parameters:
      gravity_vector - The X,Y,Z components of the gravity vector in the physics simulation

    • addBoxObject

      PhysicsObject addBoxObject(int uid, float mass, double[] transform, float[] size)
      Add a Box object to the physics world.
      Parameters:
      uid - The unique ID of the box object
      mass - The mass of the box
      transform - An array of 4x4=16 floats defining the initial transform applied to the box
      size - An array of 3 floats giving the dimensions [x,y,z] of the box
      Returns:
      A reference to the box which was addded to the physics world

    • addCylinderZObject

      PhysicsObject addCylinderZObject(int uid, float mass, double[] transform, float[] halfExtents)
      Adds a cylinder object to the physics world. This is the default cylinder used in the graphical portion of sage and is aligned length-wise with the Z-axis. For convenience this object has altered getter/setter for it's transform to align with the sage graphical cylinder. By default cylinders are created centered at (0, 0, 0), the SAGE one however is created with the center of its base at (0, 0, 0). NOTE: This does not change the other two cylinders available through this interface, they are still centered about (0, 0, 0).
      Parameters:
      uid -
      mass -
      transform -
      halfExtents -
      Returns:
      the cylinder object added to the physics world

    • addStaticPlaneObject

      PhysicsObject addStaticPlaneObject(int uid, double[] transform, float[] up_vector, float plane_constant)

    • addBallSocketConstraint

      PhysicsBallSocketConstraint addBallSocketConstraint(int uid, PhysicsObject bodyA, PhysicsObject bodyB)
      Parameters:
      uid - The unique ID of the constraint
      bodyA - The PhysicsObject of the first body
      bodyB - The PhysicsObject of the second body
      Returns:
      The newly created and added IPhysicsBallSocketConstraint

    • addHingeConstraint

      PhysicsHingeConstraint addHingeConstraint(int uid, PhysicsObject bodyA, PhysicsObject bodyB, float axisX, float axisY, float axisZ)
      Adds a hinge constraint to the world between two physics objects. The pivots can be thought of as an offset in the body's local space. For example XYZ on bodyA being 0 1 0 means that the hinge will be 1 unit above body A. The axis describes the hinge itself. For example having XYZ equal 0 1 0 means the hinge is facing the Y axis and objects constrained to this will move around that vector.
      Parameters:
      uid - The unique ID of the constraint
      bodyA - The PhysicsObject of the first body
      bodyB - The PhysicsObject of the second body
      axisX - The X value of the axis direction vector
      axisY - The Y value of the axis direction vector
      axisZ - The Z value of the axis direction vector
      Returns:
      The newly created and added IPhysicsHingeConstraint

    • removeObject

      void removeObject(int uid)
      Removes the PhysicsObject with the specified UID from the physics world, if it exists in the world.
      Parameters:
      uid - The ID of the object to be removed

    • update

      void update(float milliseconds)
      Forces the physics world to advance (that is, steps the physics simulation) by the specified amount of time, given in milliseconds.

    • nextUID

      int nextUID()
      Returns a unique ID used to identify physics objects.
